bibl.title: Francis Stephen Medcraf vs. Frank T. Hodge. Criminal.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON-NORTHERN DIVSION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. 3038 BAIL BOND.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS that we, Francis Stephen Medcraf as principal and M. M. Null and Nell J. Null, E Michael & Leomie J Michael as sureties, all of Seattle, Wash, are held and firmly bound unto THE UNITED STATESOF AMERICA for the use and benefit of any person entitled thereto, in the sum of FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($500) lawful money of these United States, for the payment of which well and truly to be made, we hereby bind ourselves, our each and of our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents.
Given under our hands this 11th day of June A. D. 1915. THE CONDITION of this obligation is such that, Whereas;

The above bounden Francis Stephen Medcraf has been arrested upon a warrant issued by Reah M. Whitehead, a Justice of the Peach of the State of Washington, charging him with practicing dentistry without a license so to do, at Seattle, King County, Washington, and was, on June 9th, 1915, convicted of said offense and sentenced to pay a fine of $50.00 and costs amounting to $8.90 and to stand committed to the county Jail of said county until such fine and costs are paid at the rate of $3.00 per day for each day of such imprisonment; and whereas

The said Francis Stephen Medcraf has applied to the United States District Court above named for a writ of Habeas Corpus to inquire into the matter aforesaid and the imprisonment of the said Francis Stephen Medcraf under the commitement issued upon such judgment and conviction, alleging that his imprisonment thereunder is illegal as being in contravention of the Constitution of the United States and of the State of Washington, and a Writ of Habeas Corpus has been duly issued by said United States District Court upon said petition and the said applicant has been brought before the Court preliminary to the hearing of said Writ and is now before said Court and the hearing thereof has been fixed for Monday, June 14th 1915 at 10 o'clock A. M. and the bail of said petitioner has been by said court fixed at $500.00;

NOW THEREFORE, if said Francis Stephen Medcraf shall and does at all times render himself amenable to the process of said Court during the pendency of said proceedings and to such as may be issued to enforce the judgment that may be rendered therein and shall be and appear at such times and places as the Court may direct in said matter and otherwise abide the order or judgment that the court may make therein, then this obligation to be void, else of full force and virtue.
Witness our hands this 11th day of June A. D. 1915. (signatures on nest page)
div1.ab: Francis Stephen Medcraf. Principal M. M. Null Nell Johnson Null his wife E. Michael. Leomie J. Michael his wife Sureties.
div1.p: State of Washington County of King ss

Be it known that on this 11th day of June A. D. 1915, before me personally came M. M. Null and Nell J. Null his wirfe, E Michael and Leomie J Michael his wife, all of Seattle, King County, Washington, who being first duly sworn do say; that they are the individuals named in and who executed the foregoing bond; that they are residents and qualified electors of the State of Washington and worth the sum of Five Hundred Dollars each, over and abodve their justs debts and liabilities and exclusive of property exempt from sale on execution.
div1.ab: M. M. Null Nell Johnson Null . E. Michael. Leomie J Michael.
div1.p: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of June A.D. 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
div1.p: State of Washington ss County of King

Be it known, that on this 11th day of June A. D. 1915, before me personally came Grancis Stephen Medcraf, M. M. Null, Nell J. Null his wife, E. Michael & Leomie J Michael his wife all of Seattle, in said County, to me known to be the same persons who executed the foregoing bond, and severally acknowledged the same to be their free and voluntary act and deed.
Given under my hand and official seal this June 11th, 1915.
div1.ab: Geo.D.Emery Notary Public for Washington Residing at Seattle.
div1.p: ORIGINAL No.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
In Re F. S. Medcraf
Habeas Corpus
Bail Bond

Service of within this day of 191 and receipt of a copy thereof, admitted,
Attorneys for
Within witness approved the 12 day of June 1915

p.del: FILED IN THE U. S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION JUN121915 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy

div1.p: FILED IN THE U. S. District Court Western Dist. of Washington NORTHERN DIVISION JUN121915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By EML Deputy 2x
div1.p: Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Petitioner
Telephone: Ellitott 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS'
